intro: Tithymalus philorus, commonly known as the yellow tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, where it is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
